properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 1:51AM CST by NWS Aberdeen SD
properties.description:
Locally strong and gusty winds are possible along the eastern
slopes of the Prairie Coteau in northeast South Dakota during the
day on Friday. Southwesterly winds of 25 to 40 mph with
occasional gusts over 55 mph are possible. The locations most
affected would be the higher terrain areas of the Prairie Coteau
as well as up to 15 miles east of the hills. This would include
Interstate 29 between Summit and Peever, or between mile markers
210 and 225. U.S. Highway 12 from Summit to Milbank may also
experience strong winds. The strong winds could promote blowing
and drifting snow, with reduced visibility and icy road
conditions. Anyone with travel plans across far northeast South
Dakota on Friday should be prepared for inclement weather and are
urged to slow down and allow for extra distance between vehicles
if need be.
